node.title: Stocks tumble amid Facebook's record $220 billion rout
node.description: Social media giant shed 25% of its value in early Thursday trading after reporting its first decline in users.

node.title: Kim back on a white horse in North Korea's latest propaganda video
node.description: The production touts Kim Jong Un's economic leadership, but doesn't mention his 7 recent missile tests in breach of U.N. sanctions.

node.title: Fewer Americans apply for jobless aid as Omicron wave recedes
node.description: Weekly unemployment claims are again falling as job market bounces back from Omicron hit.

node.title: The European Central Bank keeps rates steady, despite record inflation.
node.description: The E.C.B. held to its policy of easing off support for the economy and tolerating record-high inflation in “the interim,” leaving its interest rate untouched.

node.title: One of China’s picks for a torchbearer is an army commander who clashed with India.
node.description: The selection of Col. Qi Fabao was swiftly denounced by the Indian government, which said that the top diplomat at its embassy in Beijing would not attend the opening or closing ceremonies of the Olympics.

node.title: $100,000 reward offered over a decade after remains of 11 women found
node.description: Authorities gathered to mark the anniversary of the largest homicide case in the Albuquerque Police Department's history.

node.title: Watch Live: Biden speaks on raid in Syria that took out ISIS leader
node.description: President Biden is addressing the nation after ISIS leader Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Qurayshi was removed by U.S. forces.

node.title: Climate change could be "catastrophic" for coral reefs
node.description: Researchers said that the Paris Climate Agreement's climate change efforts "will not be enough to save most coral reefs."

node.title: Tense calm at Ukraine border as Russia slams U.S. troop deployment
node.description: While it bolsters its own massive military buildup around Ukraine, Russia again accuses the U.S. of "actions that lead to an increase in this tension."

node.title: A road in Detroit will charge an electric car while driving
node.description: Eddy Grant sang about an "electric avenue" in the 1980s. Detroit plans to bring that vision to life next year.

node.title: What's behind the push for a fourth stimulus check
node.description: IRS has distributed almost 170 million payments. But hardship remains widespread as the Omicron variant spreads.

node.title: Captain Cook's legendary ship possibly found off Rhode Island
node.description: Captain James Cook's HMS Endeavour was believed to have been deliberately sunk during the American Revolution off the coast of Rhode Island.

node.title: Texas butterfly sanctuary shutting after threats from Trump backers
node.description: Conspiracy theories have claimed the sanctuary, which is on the banks of the Rio Grande, was helping to bring illegal migrants to the U.S.

node.title: National Archives says it will give Mike Pence's records to January 6 panel
node.description: President Biden declined to uphold former President Donald Trump's claims asserting executive privilege over a new batch of documents.

node.title: Burning plant could cause "one of the worst explosions in U.S. history"
node.description: Ammonium nitrate is the same chemical compound behind the massive 2020 Beirut port explosion.

node.title: Shooting on Greyhound bus kills 1, wounds 4; suspect caught in Walmart
node.description: Authorities in Oroville, north of Sacramento, say the bus stopped behind an AMPM gas station convenience store and the suspect fled to the nearby Walmart.

node.title: For China's Uyghurs, "the genocide doesn't stop" for the Olympics
node.description: Ahead of the Olympics in Beijing, Uyghur activist Zumretay Arkin tells CBS News it feels like the world has told her people to wait quietly, and then "we'll get back to your genocide."

node.title: 49ers fan in coma after beating outside Rams' stadium
node.description: Daniel Luna was found in a parking lot outside SoFi Stadium about a half-hour into the NFC title game between San Francisco and Los Angeles. authorities said.

node.title: 49ers fan in coma after beating outside stadium in L.A.
node.description: Daniel Luna was found in a parking lot outside SoFi Stadium about a half-hour into the NFC title game between San Francisco and the L.A. Rams.

node.title: ‘Breaking Bread’ Review: Peace Meals
node.description: This documentary follows the preparations for a food festival at which chefs from Arab and Jewish backgrounds team up to create dishes together.

node.title: ‘Jackass Forever’ Review: A Visit From the Goon Squad
node.description: Sharp cinematography and enviable camaraderie continue to hoist Johnny Knoxville and friends above their many imitators in this deceptively kindhearted sequel.

node.title: ‘Poly Styrene: I Am a Cliché’ Review: An Overdue Close-up
node.description: In this new documentary, Poly Styrene’s daughter grapples tenderly with the legacy of her punk rock mother.

node.title: Art sleuth returns ancient statue to museum 49 years after heist
node.description: Arthur Brand's previous finds include a Picasso painting and "Hitler's Horses", sculptures that once stood outside the Nazi leader's Berlin chancellery.

node.title: Turkish president arrives in Kyiv and reiterates support for Ukraine’s sovereignty.
node.description: Speaking to reporters before he left Ankara, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said he was determined to help de-escalate the crisis.

node.title: Mom says she "could not prevent" son from allegedly killing campus officers
node.description: John Painter and J.J. Jefferson were known as "the dynamic duo" and Painter was the best man at Jefferson's wedding this year, the school's president said.

node.title: Women and kids reportedly killed in U.S. counterterror raid in Syria
node.description: U.S. military provided little info on the rare special ops raid in an area where al Qaeda operatives are suspected to be hiding, but said it was "successful."

node.title: Havana Syndrome may be caused by 'pulsed energy' - report
node.description: So how significant is this new report?

node.title: Shooting on Greyhound bus leaves one dead and four wounded
node.description: Authorities in Oroville, north of Sacramento, say the bus stopped behind a gas station convenience store and the suspect was caught shortly after in a nearby Walmart.

node.title: UAE says it blocked drone attack, little-known group claims responsibility
node.description: The United Arab Emirates says it intercepted three drones that entered its airspace in the fourth such attack on the Gulf commercial and tourism hub in the past few weeks.

node.title: Facebook shares drop as owner Meta warns advertising is slowing
node.description: Meta boss Mark Zuckerberg said the firm's sales growth had been hurt as audiences - especially younger users - left for rivals. More than 2.8 billion people used one of its apps daily in December, but…
